content: A Calendar component allows users to select a date. It can be used as a controlled component (with `value` and `onChange`) or an uncontrolled component (with `defaultValue`). Date values are handled using the `@internationalized/date` package.
You can restrict selectable dates using `minValue` and `maxValue` to define a range. The `isDateUnavailable` prop can be used to disable specific dates, such as weekends.
The Calendar supports month and year pickers (`showMonthAndYearPickers`), displaying multiple months (`visibleMonths`), and customizing the first day of the week (`firstDayOfWeek`).
If a selected date is invalid based on application logic, you can set the `isInvalid` prop. An `errorMessage` can also be provided to guide the user.

The Calendar component supports 13 different calendar systems (e.g., Gregorian, Islamic, Hebrew) and automatically displays the correct system based on the user's locale, which can be set in the `Provider`.
The Calendar has many stylable slots, including `base`, `header`, `title`, `grid`, `cell`, `cellButton`, `prevButton`, and `nextButton` for extensive customization.
The Calendar is fully accessible, with keyboard navigation for date cells, localized screen reader announcements, and proper ARIA attributes for states like selected, disabled, and invalid.
